title: Ticket #4735: Speed up V3 query protocol
description:
When watching condor_q V3 queries go through a busy CMS schedd (10k running jobs, 20k in queue), I observed most of the wait time was due to #4594. [Basically, DC's driver isn't called enough to iterate through the entire queue before timeout.]

I see two other things we can do:

  • During "busy spikes", anecdotally, we returned to DC about once a second. While #4594 appears to speed up the V3 protocol for very selective queries, performance still suffers on large query results (as we're using the TCP buffer of usually 128KB, we return at most 128KB / second in this case).
    • Proposal: We should use a fork worker to respond to the query from a child process. We only respond in-process if we are out of workers. This should be a nice balance of performance and memory usage - giving the admins something they can tune.
  • (Outright bug) After any pipe or socket is serviced, DaemonCore will re-invoke select on further sockets to see if they are still ready to read (comment says this is done in case if a prior handler drained this socket and the current handler is blocking). Obviously, checking a write socket to see if there's a read ready will return false. Hence, on a busy schedd, it may be very difficult to ever get DC to respond past the first set of ads.
    • Proposal: Only perform this re-check if the socket is registered read-only.
